channel.title: The Crooked Spoon – Chow Down Orlando
channel.description: Exploring all that Orlando has to offer.

image.title: The Crooked Spoon – Chow Down Orlando

item.title: The Crooked Spoon
item.dc:creator: justincox
item.description:
It’s a loosely kept secret that I think the 420 Burger from The Crooked Spoon is the best burger in town since I’ve talked about it before. But the other day I decided to branch out and try the other burger in The Crooked Spoon arsenal, the one they named after the truck: The Crooked Spoon […]

The post The Crooked Spoon appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.
item.content:encoded:
It’s a loosely kept secret that I think the 420 Burger from The Crooked Spoon is the best burger in town since I’ve talked about it before. But the other day I decided to branch out and try the other burger in The Crooked Spoon arsenal, the one they named after the truck: The Crooked Spoon Burger.

The Crooked Spoon Burger is the savory to the 420’s sweet. This burger packs quality Angus meat, melted swiss, a nice bun, lettuce, tomato, caramelized onions, and a nice chipotle aioli. It’s everything a good, quality burger should be. Like the 420, The Crooked Spoon Burger is served with homemade chips.

So which is the better burger? The 420 has delicious pineapple relish and candied bacon, whereas the Crooked Spoon carries caramelized onions and chipotle aioli. One is sweet and the other is savory. It’s very, very close, but the edge goes to the 420 simply for my love of pineapple on burgers. Otherwise it’d be a complete toss up.

Whichever burger you choose, you won’t be disappointed. Follow The Crooked Spoon on Twitter and tell me which burger you prefer.

The post The Crooked Spoon appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.

item.title: The Crooked Spoon
item.dc:creator: justincox
item.description:
Carla posted about the First Church Festival the other day which was our first encounter with The Crooked Spoon. The one thing missing from that review was the 420 Burger. It was missing for two reasons: 1) the picture I took came out awful and 2) I was looking forward to having it again to […]

The post The Crooked Spoon appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.
item.content:encoded:
Carla posted about the First Church Festival the other day which was our first encounter with The Crooked Spoon. The one thing missing from that review was the 420 Burger. It was missing for two reasons: 1) the picture I took came out awful and 2) I was looking forward to having it again to truly give it justice.

The Crooked Spoon has two burgers on their menu, the Crooked Spoon and the 420. The Crooked Spoon may be their namesake, but the 420 is my favorite burger in town. Hands down. It’s delicious.

The burger starts with angus beef and is topped with a honey mustard aoli, pineapple relish, swiss cheese and the creme de la creme, candied bacon. All of this is packed into a delicious brioche bun. If this sounds sweet, it is. There’s a nice sweet flavor that comes with the burger that makes it taste like candy – the candied bacon obviously helps. It is so good.

As Carla mentioned the other day, their Six Cheese Mac and Cranberry Turkey are also delicious, but for me, it’s all about the burger.

You can find The Crooked Spoon on Twitter.

The post The Crooked Spoon appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.

item.title: Food Truck Roundup
item.dc:creator: justincox
item.description:
First off, my apologies since it has taken me forever to actually write about all of the delicious food that you see pictured here. We had an event at our church recently that featured two of Orlando’s Food trucks: The Crooked Spoon and Melissa’s Chicken and Waffles. Round 1: Appetizers. Both trucks were setting up […]

The post Food Truck Roundup appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.
item.content:encoded:
First off, my apologies since it has taken me forever to actually write about all of the delicious food that you see pictured here. We had an event at our church recently that featured two of Orlando’s Food trucks: The Crooked Spoon and Melissa’s Chicken and Waffles.

Round 1: Appetizers.

Both trucks were setting up and I almost couldn’t contain myself in the waiting for all the prep work to be completed so that I could dig in to some good grub. Finally, the time had come and I was ready to order my first course: 6 cheese mac and cheese from the Crooked Spoon. What I thought would be delicious mac and cheese would be overcome by some of the most delicate and rich pasta I have ever eaten. Made fresh with peppers and basil, this pasta was a force to be reckoned with. I recommend this dish to anyone trying the crooked spoon for the first time.

Round 2: The Main Course.

Next we had two different sandwiches from the Crooked Spoon and nothing other than Chicken and Waffles from Melissa’s. The chicken and waffles was everything you could ever want from a dish: sweet and fluffy waffle, spicy buffalo spiced fried chicken, and a smooth peppery gravy to make it all melt in your mouth. If you have never had the pleasure of having Chicken and Waffles, might I recommend Melissa’s Chicken and Waffles as a good truck to have a great experience. The sandwiches that were consumed from the Crooked Spoon was the Turkey and Cranberry and the 420 Burger. The turkey and cranberry was light and delicious and was a great sandwich to really get me pumped for Thanksgiving, but the star of the show was the 420 burger. This burger was topped with the best accessory for avery meal: candied bacon. I truly wouldn’t mind dying a few years early if I was able to include candied bacon on everything that I eat. And the bacon was just a complement to the perfectly cooked burger. I may say this occasionally, but this time I wish I could make a plaque to deliver to the Crooked Spoon for the best burger I have ever eaten (I want to cry just thinking about the next opportunity I will have to indulge in such bliss).

As a plug for the Crooked Spoon, I would like to announce that they will be downtown! This Tuesday (12/6) the Crooked Spoon will be sitting in front of First United Methodist Church on Jackson and Magnolia downtown serving up some more of their delicious food. Come on down during your lunch break or even for a meeting (there are tables inside). See you there!

The post Food Truck Roundup appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.
